title: By far the worst preseason change....
body: Sheen now has no ability power, so in turn tri-force and ice-born gauntlet have none either... this screws over so many champs -_-

replies.body: I'm wondering why they removed it. Haven't really got up to date with the Item changes yet but they must have had some valid reason?
The reason they gave was "that it gave a wasted stat to some champs".... -_-
Who got triforce/ice-born and really needed the AP?

Tri-force:

I used it wall the time on Kha'Zix for his passive and heal and it was really good.

It was very useful for GP's oranges and Ultimate.

It was amazing for Gnar and his W passive.
(Those 3 champs, its not worth wasting a whole itemslot for an AP item so it was the only chance they got at some AP.)

Kog'Maw (self explanatory)

this is off my head so there will probably be more that I'm forgetting sorry :(



So in my opinion quite a few more needed it than 'didn't mind if it isn't there'


please can we look at adding it back in?

I'm no expert. But in my opinion while all those champions have ability power ratios they are negligible when it comes to adding power to their kits.

Hopefully these examples make sense. (I will be using the 30AP value from the old triforce)

**Kha Zix** - First of all I probably wouldn't build Triforce or iceborn on Kha. Most bros build him full AD and a bit of CDR - http://www.probuilds.net/champions/Khazix

But previously if you got Triforce the AP would give +15 damage from passive and +15 heal on W. Once again these are minor bonuses and Kha would benefit much more from building AD.
---
**Gangplank** - Now Tri Force is definitely a core item for Gangplank. While the AP provides a nice small bonus it definitely does not screw him with the removal.

30 AP gives + 27 health on W (but most of the healing is base + 15% Missing Health anyway)
30 AP gives + 36 Damage on ult or 3 damage per wave

These are minor bonuses that AP Triforce gave, and I would definitely argue the + 10% CDR it gives now is much more valuable for GP. 
---
**Gnar** - One again not a champion I could go triforce on. Most pros build him either tank and cdr or ad pen/tank and cdr - http://www.probuilds.net/champions/Gnar

But previously if you got Triforce the AP would give + 30 damage on Mini form W and + 15 damage on GNAR!. While its a nice small bonus W's main damage comes from the % max health component not the magic damage.
---
**Kog'Maw** - Tri force again a core build on Kog and previously the AP was good bonus for Kog. But now with Kog'Maws focus on W (doubles his total attack speed and attack speed cap for 6 seconds) I personally would move away from Triforce and more into Crit/onhit effects. (Try Blade of the Ruined King into IE into Runaans)

I will be happy to go over in more detail about the other champions if you want. But long story short most of the champions don't get screwed by the removal of AP and probably benefit more from the CDR you get now.

You make very good points there, i know it isn't ideal to build it on Kha but I'm stubborn sometimes xD

i guess my argument would be:
if having the AP is so minuscule a thing on champs that like having it. then why not have both AP and CDR?
if it does so little, then it shouldn't be a problem?

That argument really goes back to the patch notes explanation. I guess no one bought it for AP it was just kinda there. So by removing it we can better optimize the item (Cost vs stats) and remove the feeling of wasting gold on a stat that doesn't really help your champion.

"Costs less, no longer has ability power. Now has cooldown reduction.

One of the oldest items in the game, Sheen's ability power always made it a little awkward to use as a building block for other items (like Iceborn Gauntlet, which was always pretty confusing). Removing AP and adding cooldown reduction **adds more synergies for the champions who want the Spellblade passive without forcing an often-'wasted' stat on them.**"

But now there is no item for GP, Gnar, Kha etc etc to get AP? they wont ever get AP now. Like not exaggerating, there literally is no item for that anymore, so why bother even giving them an AP scaling?  you took lucian's ult's AS scaling away for the same reason. so will we see increased base damage/heal or something now instead of AP scaling on those champs?

I'm sorry but i just cant see the logic of taking away a stat because one or two champions felt awkward about having something they didn't use, when other champs do make use of it. 
its like if two children each have a lollypop and a chocolate bar, if one of them doesn't like chocolate and doesn't eat it, is it fair to take the chocolate away from the other child as well?

you say "adds more synergies for the champions who want the spellblade passive without forcing an often-'wasted' stat on them" but what about champions that DO want the spellblade passive AND the AP?

Like I mentioned earlier I don't feel like any champions want the spellblade passive AND AP except for lich bane users.

In my opinion Triforce and iceborn users are much better off with sheen being cheaper AND giving CDR instead.

I can't really answer about if we are planning to remove AP ratios from certain champs as I don't work on the champion design team if you want to talk to them directly head on over to the dev corner or check out the ask.fm from our Design director - http://ask.fm/RiotGhostcrawler

Now Triforce could even become a core item on Rengar, since it gives CDR, which is like essential for Rengar. The Sheen was always good for his q, and now with the switch of stats. I'm gonna build try and build this item almost every game I have a chance to.
jax and xin mainly had their strength in the ap ratios, which is why you see them being played ap sometimes simply for that. jax's 3rd autos and xins healing is gonna be so much weaker now

**Jax ** - Without the 30 AP on Tri Force he loses 21 damage. I do think the lowered sheen cost and CDR reduction benefits him more. Especially with the new {{item:3124}} item. That more than makes up for any lost ap and is potentially a super strong item for Jax now that its been changed.

**Xin** - loses 21 heal on W. I would argue the 10% CDR and cheaper sheen is better for him if you build Triforce. Most pros don't build Triforce on him, they usually opt for tank/ad/onhit effects & atkspeed. http://www.probuilds.net/champions/XinZhao
